cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian burial practices are motivated by their afterlife beliefs.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that a practice or action is motivated or driven by a belief, goal, or underlying reason.

cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
remarks: Uses the described item-burial practice as representative of broader burial practices.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Mummification supports and is motivated by ancient Egyptian beliefs about the afterlife.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject practice or action is performed or maintained because it is motivated or justified by the object belief, goal, or reason.
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts

remarks: Relation mainly to capture that the stated purpose of mummification is tied to afterlife expectations.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Ancient Egyptian afterlife beliefs about soul-body reunion motivate placing religious texts in burials.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject belief, goal, or rationale provides the motivation for including or using the object item or practice in a ritual, burial, or other context.

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Afterlife beliefs about reunion also motivate the inclusion of amulets in the burial chamber.
cluster_relations.canonical_rel_desc: Subject belief, goal, or rationale provides the motivation for including or using the object item or practice in a ritual, burial, or other context.
cluster_relations.subject_class_label: Ancient Egyptian Afterlife Beliefs and Concepts
cluster_relations.subject_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Religion and Culture
cluster_relations.object_class_group: Ancient Egyptian Funerary Practices and Burials
remarks: Parallel to the religious texts relation; kept separate for clarity.
Parallel to the religious texts relation; kept separate for clarity.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject practice or action is performed, structured, or maintained because it is motivated or justified by the object belief, goal, or rationale.
args.justification: Both relations link a ritual/funerary practice (burial practices, mummification) as being caused or driven by afterlife beliefs. They should share the same inverse-direction predicate 'is_motivated_by' and be placed in a unified class 'motivational_causality_relation' under the CAUSALITY group for consistency with the other motivational belief–practice links in the cluster.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject belief, goal, or rationale provides the motivation for performing the object practice or including/using the object item in a ritual, burial, or other context.
args.justification: These relations capture the forward causal direction: afterlife beliefs motivate inclusion/use of funerary items (texts, amulets). The previous name 'motivates_use_of' is overly specific to 'use of' and not needed when the object already encodes the item/practice. Normalizing to the more general predicate 'motivates' keeps them as the forward counterpart of 'is_motivated_by' while retaining their membership in the same motivational_causality_relation class under CAUSALITY.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject practice or action is performed, structured, or maintained because it is motivated or justified by the object belief, goal, or rationale.
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations link a ritual/funerary practice (burial practices, mummification) as being caused or driven by afterlife beliefs. They should share the same inverse-direction predicate 'is_motivated_by' and be placed in a unified class 'motivational_causality_relation' under the CAUSALITY group for consistency with the other motivational belief–practice links in the cluster.

executed_decisions.justification: These relations capture the forward causal direction: afterlife beliefs motivate inclusion/use of funerary items (texts, amulets). The previous name 'motivates_use_of' is overly specific to 'use of' and not needed when the object already encodes the item/practice. Normalizing to the more general predicate 'motivates' keeps them as the forward counterpart of 'is_motivated_by' while retaining their membership in the same motivational_causality_relation class under CAUSALITY.
